intro: Endiandra montana, commonly known as the mountain endiandra, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within lowland and montane forests. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The tree plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting diverse wildlife and contributing to forest biodiversity.
